intro: Gynoxys verrucosa var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The varietal name "grandifolia" refers to its relatively large, showy flowers.
